description: Array T by antidiagonals: for n >= 0 and k >= 1, let p(k)=least number in N not already an a(i), q(k)=p(k)+k+n-1, a(p(k))=q(k), a(q(k))=p(k); then for h>=1, T(n,h)=a(h).
comments: Each row is a self-inverse permutation of N; are the numbers in every column distinct?
links: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
author: _Clark Kimberling_
